channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Top .NET Videos & Live Streams of 2024
item.description: Let's take a look back at the amazing .NET videos, events, and live streams from 2024! Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/top-dotnet-videos-live-streams-of-2024

item.title: How various git diff viewers represent file encoding changes in pull requests
item.description: The invisible UTF-8 BOM, and sometimes invisible encoding changes. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241230-00/?p=110692

item.title: Go to line anywhere with Code Search for Visual Studio 2022
item.description: Finding the exact line of code where an issue is occurring can be like searching for a needle in a haystack. Whether you are debugging an error on line 43 of a file or diving into a specific section of code, you can efficiently jump to the right places with this newest addition to Code […] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/go-to-line-anywhere-with-code-search-for-visual-studio-2022

item.title: In C++, failure to meet the requirements does not always mean that you fail if you don’t meet the requirements
item.description: Combining SFINAE/requires, standard layout, and overload resolution. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241227-00/?p=110681

item.title: Critical: .NET Install links are changing
item.description: The .NET installers and archives distribution method is currently changing unexpectedly. This change may impact your development, CI, and production infrastructure. It is crucial to validate if you are affected and monitor for any downtime or disruptions. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/critical-dotnet-install-links-are-changing

item.title: Why are Win32 resources strings bundled at all? And why bundles of 16?
item.description: Balancing multiple performance factors. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241226-00/?p=110679

item.title: How can I check if two GUIDs are equal when they are provided as strings?
item.description: A customer asked if there was a helper function in the system that accepted two strings and reported whether the GUIDs they represent are equal. This is a tricky question, because you first have to decide what “represent” means. There are many ways of representing a GUID as a string. It could be just 32 […] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20241225-00/?p=110677

item.title: A design flaw in the Windows 3D Pipes screen saver pointed out by a customer
Connect securely to your Azure resources
item.description: Visual Studio 2022’s Connected Services features are being updated to help you start secure. In the past, for example with Azure Storage, we’d inject the entire connection string into your configuration. With this update, we’ve removed the secrets from the UX – and from what we save to configuration – altogether. This means your code […] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/connect-securely-to-your-azure-resources
